channel.title: illustrations images wishlist for Whonix
channel.description:
I've been offered to have an illustration for Whonix created. At the moment I am out of creativity what to suggest since we have no tickets for graphical TODO at the moment.
(I've been PM'd on reddit due to our [programmers wanted](https://www.reddit.com/r/INAT/comments/5k6i9k/whonix_anonymous_operating_system_developers/) post.)
The media loves images and illustration images. So do users.
Often when subgraph was in the media, they used this image: https://subgraph.com/img/sgos.png
Whonix has two illustrations that are sometimes used by the media.
* https://www.whonix.org/wiki/File:Whonix_concept_refined.jpg * https://www.whonix.org/wiki/File:Stream_isolation.1.0.jpg
I think there is some room for enhancement here.
Do you have any ideas what kind of illustration images do you suggest for Whonix to be created?

item.title: illustrations images wishlist for Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
AppArmor for Complete System - Including init, PID1, Systemd, Everything! - Full System MAC policy
AppArmor for Complete System - Including init, PID1, Systemd, Everything! - Full System MAC policy

I think a nice infographic would be good for https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Kicksecure

Something like:

But probably by someone far better at graphic design than me.

Seems very possible. Could even be more complex than that but it needs to be drafted.
Graphics only. No technical concept development. A sketch (as you provided) or description required.

Read full topic

item.title: illustrations images wishlist for Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Anyhow, I guess if the contributor would be willing to divvy up a nice high def Whonix logo image that could be inserted into that page,

Well, as far as the contributor “creativity isn’t included either”. I
need to formulate specific instructions what to do. “Creatively create
something new” isn’t included.

This contribution is limited to “if you have specific ideas about what
illustration to create, it can be created”.

it would be far better than the retro 90s things we have go going on (I think you’d agree?).

No, I would like to to agree or disagree but I really don’t know. Also
heard good things about the current logo. I don’t have tools for
measurement of opinion (well, could make more polls) nor tools of
“objective measurement” if that’s even possible.

What happened to the Whonix logo contest? Someone remind me?

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Logo_Contest

Forgotten about. Was just a wiki page that was never discussed?

Maybe the Whonix logo contest idea should be revived but that should
happen in a dedicated forum thread.

See also logo 2016 vs 2020

Whonix – 26 Jan 20

Dev/Logo - Whonix

Whonix ™ Logo

Did that help? Good enough?

Related:

polls collections (surveys) Development
(baseline)

Read full topic

item.title: illustrations images wishlist for Whonix
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
Patrick:

Any reference?

I forget where we chatted about that, maybe earlier in the Long Wiki edits mega-thread. Anyhow, I guess if the contributor would be willing to divvy up a nice high def Whonix logo image that could be inserted into that page, it would be far better than the retro 90s things we have go going on (I think you’d agree?).

Read full topic

item.title: illustrations images wishlist for Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
torjunkie via Whonix Forum:

Do they have the ability to work on the Whonix landing page for Tor Browser or is that out of scope i.e. wiki only?

Landing page vs wiki doesn’t matter. But image (illustration) creation
only. Image creation can be contributed but installation is up to me.

As previously discussed,

Any reference?

it would make a big difference in terms of a positive impression if that page was modern & fresh e.g. modern font, high-def Whonix image, perhaps better color and contrast. Particularly since Tor Browser is the main component used constantly.

No CSS / html possible but I might have someone else for that.

Read full topic

I’ve been offered to have an illustration for Whonix created.

item.title: illustrations images wishlist for Whonix
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
I think the “How Whonix Works” picture should combine four things into a complicated illustration like Subgraph’s.

Effectively, you want to show:

  1. Separate host OS (Xen or other)
  2. Whonix-WS connecting to a Whonix-GW
  3. Whonix-GW choosing random paths through the Tor network with the last step (often) being an unencrypted link - this could be updated to show encrypted connections if .onions
  4. Stream isolation

If the illustrator is good enough, they need to combine the following three images below into something sensible. It probably could be a 3d image like Subgraph’s to fit it all in.

https://forums.whonix.org/uploads/default/original/1X/cda560447ac50e55d038c45433f54c35d858ff61.jpg

https://forums.whonix.org/uploads/default/original/1X/80d2442ebdef91205851a08745d836f8a95653e3.jpg

Read full topic

item.title: illustrations images wishlist for Whonix
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

I’d say an image not unlike the one used by Subgraph might be a good idea. A single one which shows newcomers the advantages of Whonix in a second.

Have a nice day,

Ego
